Notes.Text:
This update for libssh2_org fixes the following issue:

- CVE-2019-17498: Fixed an integer overflow in a bounds check that might have led to the disclosure of sensitive information or a denial of service (bsc#1154862).

Vulnerabilities.Description: In libssh2 v1.9.0 and earlier versions, the SSH_MSG_DISCONNECT logic in packet.c has an integer overflow in a bounds check, enabling an attacker to specify an arbitrary (out-of-bounds) offset for a subsequent memory read. A crafted SSH server may be able to disclose sensitive information or cause a denial of service condition on the client system when a user connects to the server.
